question: Some people believe that violence on television and in computer games has a damaging effect on society. Others, however, deny that these factors have any significant influence on people’s behaviour.What is your opinion on that issue?
text: It is often argued that violent programs and games improve bad behaviour in people, while others suggest that this does not have any effect on people's behaviours. I believe, violent entertainment makes people also more violent. The following paragraphs will highlight my opinion based on  both beliefs with some relevant examples.

First of all, violent games, such as shut, killing, and fighting have been increasing in recent years. Nowadays, many children have the access to these kinds of games, and with that, children grow up in an environment learning the strategies of being a better killer and bad manners. For instance, a child who is only five years old  knows about all the weapons and how to use them. Moreover, they also get angry while playing and release the stress of killing and fighting on the video game.

In addition, adults have been expressing more violence in many situations. That is because individuals have been watching too much bad news and people tend to copy others' actions. Some programs  showed the traffic and in many ,situations drivers try to solve their problems and stresses by taking a fight with  others. Although it is not the best way to resolve, the watcher's support aside. For example, the news program is always showing someone who has taken advantage of fighting, a family at home makes who wons as a hero and in a similar situation, they would do the same.
To conclude, in my opinion, violent games and tv programs encourage people to be more violent. There should have better content for both children and adults.
